TopicTitle: [1.1.2]Aerojet Kerbodyne 3.0 (4/29/16 Better FX, still good for 1.1.2)

Articles.Content:
Here is something I have been working lately... A remodel that will break saves. The release that will be packed with this will be a resized Taurus SM for pairing with SDHI. I will (again) remodel the Service Module as well.

Shiny! I was hoping for something like that. Can't wait to see it textured, and flying!

Shiny! I was hoping for something like that. Can't wait to see it textured, and flying!

Cancel the resizing, I think I'll be integrating it with TweakScale

Alright, update, I textured the upper tank and as I have written there, it is planned to share textures with the others (being 2.5m-1.58m Adapter and 1.58m tank). The engine will be a separate texture.

The Trusus parts do not resize well with the Realism Overhaul mod (and the new engine doesn't have the EngineIgnitor settings yet). Is this something that belongs here or should I post it in the Realism Overhaul mod thread?

Thank you for this great mod!

Cancel the resizing, I think I'll be integrating it with TweakScale

Nooooooooo... Sigh, as you wish, I can understand why. But I'll probably end up removing it and making two separate SM.

It looks great anyway! ^^

Edited August 5, 2014 by Initar

The Trusus parts do not resize well with the Realism Overhaul mod (and the new engine doesn't have the EngineIgnitor settings yet). Is this something that belongs here or should I post it in the Realism Overhaul mod thread?

Thank you for this great mod!

Might want to post it there because I have no idea how those work, some guys working and playing with ROv knows their work around those like RedAV8R.

Nooooooooo... Sigh, as you wish, I can understand why. But I'll probably end up removing it and making two separate SM.

It looks great anyway! ^^

Making tweakscale integration will make it easier to switch sizes by the click of a button
Does the Heatshield work with DeadlyReentryContinued?

Does the Heatshield work with DeadlyReentryContinued?

Yes it does. On update:

That looks great! Although less stockalike than the old one.

I don't see any flames / heat / whatever kind of visuals when I fire the LAS. It works but there are no visuals.

The LAS also is missing an "allowShutdown" attribute: #17

Can't wait for update. Love your mods Black Heart. Just wish I didn't have a poor laptop so I could run more of your mods without hitting the RAM limit but I will always use this mod because it's just so darn handy!

Thanks

Nice "X" truss!!

You tempted to include it in your pack?

That looks great! Although less stockalike than the old one.

It looks less derpy but it uses base color of kerbodyne tanks, even the Adapter Truss is painted kerbodyne black haha

I don't see any flames / heat / whatever kind of visuals when I fire the LAS. It works but there are no visuals.

The LAS also is missing an "allowShutdown" attribute: #17

Is this an issue with the sensible pumps? Just wanna know.

Can't wait for update. Love your mods Black Heart. Just wish I didn't have a poor laptop so I could run more of your mods without hitting the RAM limit but I will always use this mod because it's just so darn handy!

Thanks

Sir, the next update will be more efficient in ram space more than the past one (and looks better!)

Update

Textures Done

Emissives Done

FX Done (at least if you guys are satisfied with this)

It's the best I can get that feels some thing actually come out of the engine.

*looks at images*

Holy hell.

*THUD*

FX Done (at least if you guys are satisfied with this)

Actually, on the Hotrockets page, someone just got expanding exhaust with atmo density. Figured I'd point it out.

Textures and meshes look great, by the way.

*looks at images*

Holy hell.

*THUD*

this was my reaction

Edit: also are you planning on having different rocket nozzles in the future for the service module extension?

Edited August 6, 2014 by Helix935

Actually, on the Hotrockets page, someone just got expanding exhaust with atmo density. Figured I'd point it out.

Textures and meshes look great, by the way.

Heeeey, totally cool. sarbian told me about it and I was too lazy to figure out I'll see what I can do, it's gonna be neat if I can use it.

this was my reaction

Edit: also are you planning on having different rocket nozzles in the future for the service module extension?

Like this?

I was planning to but I can't promise, we'll see.

Is this an issue with the sensible pumps? Just wanna know.

Yes, if using sensible pump this seems to be causing issues (the LES stops firing when I try to jettison it). But sensible pumps can of course be disabled for the part in VAB manually.

What I wrote about the missing flame / fire / engine visuals on the LES also applies to the other engines. No flames at all for me.

Also the interstage adapter seems to create some wobble on my rocket but I'm still investigating it.
Alright, thanks for telling, I should add compatibility to that next update.

Worked on some more add-ons for SDHI (SDHI is still needed because it has the umbilical feature for the Mk1-2pod and I don't plan to replicate it at the moment, I traced the model so it's just same sized)

https://i.imgur.com/gu7M2XU.pnghttps://i.imgur.com/2Bxi11q.png

Worked on some more add-ons for SDHI (SDHI is still needed because it has the umbilical feature for the Mk1-2pod and I don't plan to replicate it at the moment, I traced the model so it's just same sized)

It looks good but if you just want to expand SDHI why are basically making SDHI parts? Don't get me wrong they are beautiful but unless you plan on making an expansion like SDHI instead of adding to SDHI why make the stuff that is already made. It seems it will just creat confusion in the VAB.
Are you going to supply the ATV-alike version with the 4 small engine nozzles rather than the one large one seen on Constellation versions of Orion?

It looks good but if you just want to expand SDHI why are basically making SDHI parts? Don't get me wrong they are beautiful but unless you plan on making an expansion like SDHI instead of adding to SDHI why make the stuff that is already made. It seems it will just creat confusion in the VAB.

True, but.... this is the reason:

Are you going to supply the ATV-alike version with the 4 small engine nozzles rather than the one large one seen on Constellation versions of Orion?

I'm making a more accurate version than SDHI though I still appreciate the work, I don't want to overwrite it, rather, I wanna work side by side with it, the one I am creating right now is the ATV version which means I'll add something like the 4 small engine nozzles + oms version than the large engine but I'll also add the large on for constellation.

The ATV version is planned to be able to store some amount of Life Support like TAC for example. (I planned KAS container on config but no idea how to get from inside the tank realistically so I didn't want to do it)

All in all, this will now look more like a more modern stockalike derived (almost every color on textures are stockalikes). More detailed and job specific service module and engines which are detailed as well, as you saw in HG-10B-2. Tweakscale is planned for tanks.

Textures are efficiently UV mapped, shared by 2 or more parts at some point, model have low polys but still look good to me. 1024*1024 textures.

Here, have a look:

Texture Done in Service Module but still working on Decoupler bumps.

Trying to copy SDHI's umbilical texture to do will be the bump map. I can't understand the last one plug on the umbilical so I typed whatever.

I'm sleepy so that's an update for now.

PS, I also do this because I like to (not a major reason but motivation)

True, but.... this is the reason:

I'm making a more accurate version than SDHI though I still appreciate the work, I don't want to overwrite it, rather, I wanna work side by side with it, the one I am creating right now is the ATV version which means I'll add something like the 4 small engine nozzles + oms version than the large engine but I'll also add the large on for constellation.

The ATV version is planned to be able to store some amount of Life Support like TAC for example. (I planned KAS container on config but no idea how to get from inside the tank realistically so I didn't want to do it)

All in all, this will now look more like a more modern stockalike derived (almost every color on textures are stockalikes). More detailed and job specific service module and engines which are detailed as well, as you saw in HG-10B-2. Tweakscale is planned for tanks.

Textures are efficiently UV mapped, shared by 2 or more parts at some point, model have low polys but still look good to me. 1024*1024 textures.

Ahhhhh ok that makes sense. It is beautiful well done and I look forward to it.
